3.Thomas Cleary: And God is what is worthy of worship in the heavens and the earth: God knows your secret and your manifestation, and God knows what you deserve.

11.Thomas Cleary: Say, "Travel over the earth and see what became of those who rejected truth as false."

12.Thomas Cleary: Say, "To whom belongs what is in the heavens and earth?” Say, "To God, self-committed to mercy. God will surely gather you all for the day of judgment in which there is no doubt; those who have lost their own souls are those who do not believe.

13.Thomas Cleary: "And to God belongs all that dwells in the night and in the day; and God is all-hearing, all-knowing.”

14.Thomas Cleary: Say, "Shall I take for friend and protector any other than God, creator of the heavens and the earth? For God feeds but is not fed.” Say, "I am commanded to be the first of those who submit to God; and you should not be idolatrous.”

32.Thomas Cleary: And the life of this world is nothing but play and sport: and indeed the abode hereafter is best for the conscientious; so won't you understand?

38.Thomas Cleary: And there is no beast upon the earth nor bird that flies on wings but forms communities like you: We have not omitted anything from the Book; and after a time they will be gathered, called unto their Lord.

42.Thomas Cleary: And We did send envoys to communities before you, and seized them with misfortune and affliction, that they might humble themselves.

43.Thomas Cleary: But why did they not humble themselves when Our misfortune reached them? Instead their hearts hard 1.ed. and Obsession made charming to them what they used to do.

44.Thomas Cleary: Then when they forgot what they had been reminded of, We opened for them the doors of all things, till they smiled at what they had been given. Unexpectedly We seized them, and then they despaired.

45.Thomas Cleary: And so was cut off the last remnant of the people who did wrong; and the praise belongs to God. Lord of the universe.

46.Thomas Cleary: Say “Do you imagine. should God take your hearing and your seeing and seal your hearts. some god other than God that will restore them?" Observe how We explain the Signs, and yet they turn away.

47.Thomas Cleary: Say, "Do you think that if there came to you the punishment of God. unexpectedly or obviously. any will be destroyed except the people who are unjust?”

48.Thomas Cleary: We only send the envoys as bearers of good tidings and as warners; so whoever believe and amend themselves have nothing to fear and will not sorrow.

50.Thomas Cleary: Say, “I do not tell you I have the treasures of God; and I do not know the unseen. And I do not tell you that I am an angel. I only follow what wat revealed to me." Say, "'Are the blind and the seeing equal? So will you not consider?”

51.Thomas Cleary: So warn by this those who fear they'll be gathered to their Lord: other than God there is for them no protector and no intercessor; thus may they be wary.

52.Thomas Cleary: And do not drive away those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening seeking the essence of God: you are not accountable for them, and they are not accountable for you. So if you drive them away, you will be an oppressor.

53.Thomas Cleary: And thus have We tried some of them by others, that they might say, "'Are these the ones whom God has graced from our midst? Does not God know best who are the grateful ones?

54.Thomas Cleary: And when there come to you those who believe in Our signs. say. “Peace upon you.” Your Lord is self-committed to mercy, so that if any among you do something bad in ignorance but then repent and make amends. assuredly God is forgiving and merciful.

56.Thomas Cleary: Say, “I am forbidden to worship those upon whom you call other than God.” Say, “I do not follow your desires; I would have strayed in that case. and would not be among the guided."

57.Thomas Cleary: Say. “I act on evidence from my Lord, though you consider it false. I do not have what you seek to hasten; God alone has the wisdom. God tells the truth and is the best of judges."

59.Thomas Cleary: For with God are the keys of the unseen; no one knows them but God. And God knows what is on the land and in the sea; and not a single leaf falls but God knows it. And there is not a single grain in the darknesses of earth, nor anything green, or withered

60.Thomas Cleary: And it is God who takes your souls by night, and knows what you have acquired by day; then resurrects you in it, that an appointed term may be fulfilled. Thence your destination is to God, who will then acquaint you with what you have done.

95.Thomas Cleary: Surely it is God who splits the seed and the stone, bringing the living from the dead; and it is God who brings the dead. from the living. That is God; so how can you be deceived?

96.Thomas Cleary: God ca uses the dawn to break, and has n1.ade the night for rest, and the sun and moon for reckoning; that is the ordering of the Mighty, the Knowing.

97.Thomas Cleary: It is God who has made the stars for you that you may be guided by them in the darknesses of land and of sea. We have defined the signs for a people who discern.

98.Thomas Cleary: It is God who has produced you all from a single self; so here is an abode, and a lodging. We have defined the signs for a people who understand.

114.Thomas Cleary: So shall I seek a judge other than God. the very one who sent the Book to you clearly explained? And those to whom We gave the Book know it is a revelation from your Lord in truth: so do not be any part of those who doubt.

115.Thomas Cleary: And the word of your Lord is fulfilled in truthfulness and justice: there is no changing the divine word, for God is all-hearing, all-knowing.

116.Thomas Cleary: But if you were to obey most of those on earth, they would divert you from the way of God: for they follow but conjecture. and they only tell untruth.

117.Thomas Cleary: Surely your Lord knows best who has strayed from the way of God; and God knows best who are guided.

120.Thomas Cleary: So forsake all sin. both open and secret; for those who are guilty of sin will be recompensed for what they have gained.

122.Thomas Cleary: And can those who were dead but We brought to life and gave a light wherewith to walk among humanity be as those who are in the dark and cannot emerge from it? Thus for the ungrateful what they have done is made to seem pleasing to them.

130.Thomas Cleary: Assembly of spirits and humanity! Did there not come to you messengers from among you relating My signs and warning you of the meeting of this day of yours? They will say, “we bear witness against ourselves.” For the life of the world deceived them with v

159.Thomas Cleary: As for those who split their religion and divide up into sects, you have no part in them at all: their affair is up to God alone, who will acquaint them with what they have been doing.

160.Thomas Cleary: For those who do good is ten times that much; and those who do evil will not be rewarded but by its like: and they will not be wronged.

162.Thomas Cleary: Say, "Truly my prayer and total devotion and my life and my death are for God, Lord of the worlds.

163.Thomas Cleary: "No partner has God: this a1nI instructed; and I am the first of those who submit."

164.Thomas Cleary: Say, “Shall I seek a lord other than God, who is Lord of all things? And no soul earns but what is due it, and none bears the burden of another. Ultimately your destination is to your Lord, who will acquaint you with that on which you differed."

2.Thomas Cleary: A Book has been sent down to you, so let there be no constriction in your chest from it, that you may warn by it, a reminder to believers.

3.Thomas Cleary: Follow what has been sent down to you all from your Lord, and follow no protector but God. Little do you heed.

4.Thomas Cleary: How many communities have We destroyed and visited with Our vengeance in their homes by night or as they slept by day?

5.Thomas Cleary: And never was their cry, when Our vengeance came to them, anything but "We were wrong!"

6.Thomas Cleary: And We will question those to whom the message was sent, and We will question the messengers.

7.Thomas Cleary: And we will tell them all with knowledge, for We are never absent.

8.Thomas Cleary: And the balance on that day will be the Truth: and those whose scales are heavy are the happy ones.

9.Thomas Cleary: And those whose scales are light are those who have lost their own souls because they mistreated Our signs.

10.Thomas Cleary: We have established you on earth, and We have provided you livelihood there: little is your gratitude.

11.Thomas Cleary: And We created you and formed you: and then We said to the angels, "'Bow to Adam." And they bowed, save Ibliis, who was not of those who bowed.

12.Thomas Cleary: God said, "What prevented you from bowing when I commanded you?" Ibliis said, “I am better than he: You created me of fire,.• but You created him of clay.”

13.Thomas Cleary: God said, “Then descend from here: it is not for you to exalt yourself here. Get out then; for you are among the vile.”

14.Thomas Cleary: Ibliis said, "'Grant me respite until the day they are resurrected.”

15.Thomas Cleary: God said, “You shall be of those granted respite."

16.Thomas Cleary: Ibliis said, "Then in view of the fact that You have made me stray, I will lie in wait for them on Your righteous path.

17.Thomas Cleary: "And I intend to come upon them, to their faces and behind their backs and from their right and their left: and You will not find most of them grateful to You."

18.Thomas Cleary: God said, "Get out of here, despised and rejected: indeed, if any of them follow you, I will fill hell with you all.

19.Thomas Cleary: "But you, Adam, dwell in the garden, you and your wife, and eat of whatever you want; but do not come near this tree, lest you become abusive oppressors."

20.Thomas Cleary: Then the Obsessor whispered to them suggestions to expose to them their shame,· which had been hidden from them, and said, "Your Lord has only forbidden you this tree lest you become angels or immortals."

21.Thomas Cleary: And he swore to them, "I am a sincere adviser to you."

22.Thomas Cleary: So he made the two fall by means of vain hope: and when they tasted of the tree, their shame was exposed to them; and they began to sew together leaves from the garden to cover themselves. And their Lord called to them, "Did I not forbid you that tree, an

23.Thomas Cleary: They said, “Our Lord! We have oppressed ourselves! And if You do not forgive u and have mercy on us, We will surely be lost."

24.Thomas Cleary: God said, “Descend, enemies of one another: there is for you a dwelling on earth and provisions for a while.”

25.Thomas Cleary: God said, “There you will live, and there you will die; but you will be taken out of there.”

26.Thomas Cleary: Descendants of Adam! We have sent you clothing to hide your shame and adorn you; though the garment of conscience is best. That is among the signs of God, so they may take heed.

27.Thomas Cleary: Descendants of Adam! I et the Obsessor not tempt you as when he had your ancestors expelled from the garden, stripping from them their clothing to show them their shame. Indeed, he sees you, he and his cohorts, from where you do not see them: for We have

28.Thomas Cleary: And when they do what is shameful, they say, “we found our fathers at it, and God has directed us to it." Say, “God does not command anything that is shameful: will you say of God what you do not know?"

29.Thomas Cleary: Say, “My Lord has commanded justice, and to direct your being right to God in every place of worship; and call upon God, true to God in faith: you shall revert to how God first made you."

30.Thomas Cleary: Some God has guided, while some have deservingly strayed. for they took to obsessions, these instead of God, and think they are the guided ones.

31.Thomas Cleary: Descendants of Adam. wear your adornments at every place of worship. and eat and drink: but do not be extravagant, for God does not love those who waste.

33.Thomas Cleary: Say. “My Lord has only forbidden what is shameful. open or secret; and iniquity, and unjust oppression; and that you associate anything with God for which no authority has been revealed; and that you say of God what you do not know."

35.Thomas Cleary: Descendants of Adam! Whenever a messenger from among you comes to you relating My signs, those who are conscientious and amend their lives have nothing to fear and they will not grieve.

36.Thomas Cleary: But those who repudiate Our signs and treat them with contempt are the inhabitants of the fire, those who remain therein.

87.Thomas Cleary: And if there is among you a group who believes in what I have been sent with, and a group who does not believe, then be patient until God judges between us, for God is the best of judges.

94.Thomas Cleary: We never sent a prophet to a city without afflicting its people with misery and distress so that they might become humble.

95.Thomas Cleary: Then We exchanged advantage for adversity until they grew, and said, "Our fathers too were touched by distress and prosperity.” Then We suddenly seized them, while they were unawares.

96.Thomas Cleary: But if only the people of the cities were faithful and conscientious, We would surely have opened for them blessings from heaven and earth: but they repudiated truth as lies. so We took them to task for what they did deserve.

152.Thomas Cleary: As for those who have made idols for themselves, wrath from their Lord will overtake them, and degradation in the life of this world: thus do We pay inventors of lies.

153.Thomas Cleary: But to those who have done wrong yet repent thereafter and believe, your Lord is most forgiving after that, most merciful.

155.Thomas Cleary: Moses chose seventy of his people for an appointment with God: and when violent shaking seized them, he said, "My Lord! If You wished, You could have already destroyed them, and me as well: will You destroy us for the deeds of the ignorant fools among us?

156.Thomas Cleary: "And ordain good for us in this world and the hereafter: for we have turned to You.” God said, “I strike with My punishment whomever I will. But My mercy extends to all things; so I will make it the destiny of those who are conscientious and charitable, a

172.Thomas Cleary: When your Lord brought forth from the offspring of Adam descendants from their loins and had them testify regarding themselves -“AM NOT YOUR LORD?” They said, “Oh yes! We so testify!” Lest you say on Judgment Day, “We were heedless of this!”

177.Thomas Cleary: A bad example are the people who have repudiated Our signs, thus oppressing their own souls.

178.Thomas Cleary: Those whom God does guide are thus those rightly guided; and those God leads astray are the ones who lose.

179.Thomas Cleary: And We have made for hell many sprites and humans: they have hearts, but do not understand with them; and they have eyes, but do not see with them; and they have ears, but do not hear with them. They are like cattle, but even more astray; they are the hee

180.Thomas Cleary: The most beautiful names are God's, so call on God by them, avoiding those who profane the names: they will be given their due for what they have been doing.

181.Thomas Cleary: And of those We have created is a people who guide by truth and with it render justice.

204.Thomas Cleary: And when the Recital is read. listen to it silently that you may be blessed with mercy.

205.Thomas Cleary: And remember your Lord within your soul in humility and awe, morning and evening, without ostentation in words; and do not be of the heedless.

206.Thomas Cleary: Those with your Lord are not too arrogant to worship; they honor and bow to God.

11.Thomas Cleary: God initiates creation, then repeats it; then to God you are returned.

12.Thomas Cleary: And on the day the hour arrives, sinners will be despondent.

13.Thomas Cleary: And they will have no intercessors from among their idols, and they will cure these idols of theirs.

14.Thomas Cleary: And on the day the hour arrives, on that day they will be divided:

15.Thomas Cleary: those who had faith and did good works will be gladdened in a garden;

16.Thomas Cleary: while those who disbelieved and repudiated Our signs and the final meeting will be brought to punishment.

17.Thomas Cleary: So glorify God as you enter into the evenings and as you enter into the mornings-

18.Thomas Cleary: for to God belongs all praise in the heavens and the earth- and at dusk and noontide.

19.Thomas Cleary: God brings forth the living from the. dead, and brings forth the dead from the living; and God enlivens the earth after its death: and so will you all be brought forth.

20.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of God is creating you all from dust; and there you are, humankind, propagating widely.

21.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of God is having created for you mates from yourselves that you may feel at home with them, and God put love and kindness among you. Surely in that is a sign for a reflective people.

22.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of od is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your languages and your complexions. Surely in that is a sign for the knowing.

23.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of God is your sleep by night and by day, and your seeking from the bounty of God. Surely in that is a sign for a people who hear.

24.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of God is showing you lightning, occasion for fear and for hope; and God sends water down from the sky. enlivening the earth after it has died. Surely in that is a sign for an intelligent people.

25.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of God is that sky and earth stand by divine decree. Then when God calls you with a call from earth, you will all come forth.

26.Thomas Cleary: To God belongs everyone in the heavens and the earth: all are obedient to God.

27.Thomas Cleary: And God it is who begins creation, then repeats it: and that is supremely easy for God. And to God refers the highest ideal in the heavens and the earth: and God is almighty, most wise.

28.Thomas Cleary: God gives you an example from your own realm: have you slaves who are partners in what We have provided for you. and you are equals in it, you fearing them as you fear yourselves? Thus do we explain the signs to an understanding people.

2.Thomas Cleary: We have not sent the Recital down to you that you should be miserable,

3.Thomas Cleary: but only as a reminder to those who fear God,

4.Thomas Cleary: a revelation from the Creator of the earth and the heavens on high,

5.Thomas Cleary: the Compassionate One established on the Throne,

6.Thomas Cleary: to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and on earth, and what is between them, and what is under the soil.

7.Thomas Cleary: So if you speak the word aloud, surely God knows the secret, and what is most deeply concealed.

8.Thomas Cleary: God is the only God, to whom belong the most beautiful names.

1.Thomas Cleary: Their reckoning has drawn near for humankind, while they tum away in heedlessness.

2.Thomas Cleary: Whenever there comes to them a new reminder from their Lord, they ridicule it as they hear it,

3.Thomas Cleary: their hearts inattentive. And they keep their conferences secret, do those who act oppressively: "Is this but a man like yourselves? Will you then take to sorcery, with open eyes?"

4.Thomas Cleary: [The Prophet] said, "My Lord knows what is said in heaven and on earth; God is all-hearing and all-knowing."

5.Thomas Cleary: "No," they say, "it is a jumble of dreams." "No, he made it up." "No, he is a poet." "Let him produce a sign like what was revealed by the ancients."

6.Thomas Cleary: No community before them that We destroyed believed: will they then believe?

7.Thomas Cleary: And We never sent before you any but men whom We inspired: so ask the people who have been reminded if you do not know.

8.Thomas Cleary: And We did not give them bodies that did not eat food; and they were not immortal.

9.Thomas Cleary: Then We fulfilled the promise and We saved them, and those We willed to save. And We destroyed the wasteful, who went beyond all bounds.

10.Thomas Cleary: We have sent to you a Book in which is a reminder for you all: will you not then comprehend?

11.Thomas Cleary: How many communities have We annihilated as wrongdoers and oppressors, and produced other peoples after them?

12.Thomas Cleary: And when they feel Our vengeance, they flee from it.

13.Thomas Cleary: Do not flee, but return to what has been given you of the good things in this life, and to your homes, so that you may be questioned.

14.Thomas Cleary: They said, "To our dismay, we were indeed wrongdoers!"

15.Thomas Cleary: And that did not cease to be their cry until We mowed them down, reduced to dead ashes.

16.Thomas Cleary: And not in play did We create heaven and earth and all that is between them.

17.Thomas Cleary: Had We wished to take to sport. We would have made one from Our Own domain if We were to do so.

18.Thomas Cleary: No, but We do hurl Truth against falsehood, and It breaks its head, and falsehood perishes. And woe to you all for what you assert.

19.Thomas Cleary: To God belongs all those in the heavens and on the earth: and those in the presence Divine are not too proud to worship God. and neither do they weary:

20.Thomas Cleary: they glorify God unceasingly. by night and by day.

21.Thomas Cleary: Have they taken to gods from the earth who resurrect the dead?

22.Thomas Cleary: Had there been gods in heaven and earth other than The God, both would surely have gone to ruin. So glory to God. Lord of the Throne. beyond what they describe.

23.Thomas Cleary: God is not questioned for what God does; they are the ones to be questioned.

24.Thomas Cleary: Have they taken to gods other than The One? Say, “Bring your proof. This is the reminder of those who are with me, and the reminder of those before me.” But most of them do not know the truth, and so they turn away.

25.Thomas Cleary: Whenever We sent an envoy, We revealed to him that there is nothing to worship but Me, so worship Me.

26.Thomas Cleary: Yet they say, “The Compassionate One has gotten a son; glory to Him!” No, they are but honored servants:

27.Thomas Cleary: they do not speak before God does, and they act by God's decree.

28.Thomas Cleary: God knows what lays before them and what is behind them: and they do not intercede but for those with whom God is pleased, and they are wary for fear of God.

29.Thomas Cleary: And if any of them say, “I am to be worshiped instead of God," for that We reward them with hell: thus do we recompense wrongdoers.

30.Thomas Cleary: Do not the ungrateful perceive that the heavens and the earth were united together, then We split them apart? And We made from water all living things. Will they not have faith?

31.Thomas Cleary: And We set upon the earth immovable mountains, lest it quake with them; and We set on it pathways as roads, so that they might be guided.

32.Thomas Cleary: And We made the sky a roof, protected; yet they turn away from its signs.

33.Thomas Cleary: And God it is who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon, each swimming in an orbit.

34.Thomas Cleary: And We have not granted permanence to anyone before you. If then you will die, are they to be here forever?

35.Thomas Cleary: Every soul experiences death. And We try you all by ill and by good as experiential proof. And to Us you will all be returned.

36.Thomas Cleary: And when ingrates without faith see you, they only take you for a joke: “Is this the one who mentions your gods?" While they themselves reject reminder of The Compassionate One.

37.Thomas Cleary: Humankind is made of haste. I will show you all My signs, so do not try to hurry Me.

38.Thomas Cleary: And they say, “When is this promise fulfilled, if you are being truthful?"

39.Thomas Cleary: If only disbelievers knew of the time when they cannot ward off the fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be helped!

40.Thomas Cleary: No, it will come upon them unawares, and confound them, so they cannot avert it, and no respite will they have.

41.Thomas Cleary: And Messengers before you have indeed been mocked; but the scoffers were surrounded by what they had been mocking.

42.Thomas Cleary: Say, “Who can protect you from the Compassionate One by night and by day?" But they turn away from mention of their Lord.

43.Thomas Cleary: Have they gods to defend them instead of Us? They are unable to help themselves, and they are not protected from Us.

44.Thomas Cleary: But We let these people enjoy things. they and their forefathers until life grew long to them. Do they not then see that We affect the earth, reducing it from its borders? Will they then be the winners?

45.Thomas Cleary: Say, "I only warn you all by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they happen to be warned.

46.Thomas Cleary: But if there touched them a breath of the punishment of their Lord. they would surely say. "To our dismay. we were doing wrong!"

47.Thomas Cleary: And We will set up the scales of justice for the day of reckoning: and no soul shall be wronged in anything. And be it the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth: and We are well able to take account.

48.Thomas Cleary: And We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, and Light, and a reminder for the conscientious,

49.Thomas Cleary: those who fear their Lord in secret, and who are dreading the Hour.

50.Thomas Cleary: And this is a blessed message We have sent: will you all then reject it?

41.Thomas Cleary: Do you not see that God is glorified by all beings in the heavens and the earth, even the birds on the wing? Each one knows its own mode of prayer and of praise: and God is aware of all that they do.

19.Thomas Cleary: God brings forth the living from the . dead, and brings forth the dead from the living; and God enlivens the earth after its death: and so will you all be brought forth.

20.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of God is creating you all from dust; and there you are, humankind, propagating widely.

21.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of God is having created for you mates from yourselves that you may feel at home with them, and God put love and kindness among you. Surely in that is a sign for a reflective people.

22.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of od is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your languages and your complexions. Surely in that is a sign for the knowing.

23.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of God is your sleep by night and by day, and your seeking from the bounty of God. Surely in that is a sign for a people who hear.

24.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of God is showing you lightning, occasion for fear and for hope; and God sends water down from the sky. enlivening the earth after it has died. Surely in that is a sign for an intelligent people.

25.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of God is that sky and earth stand by divine decree. Then when God calls you with a call from earth, you will all come forth.

26.Thomas Cleary: To God belongs everyone in the heavens and the earth: all are obedient to God.

27.Thomas Cleary: And God it is who begins creation, then repeats it: and that is supremely easy for God. And to God refers the highest ideal in the heavens and the earth: and God is almighty, most wise.

28.Thomas Cleary: God gives you an example from your own realm: have you slaves who are partners in what We have provided for you. and you are equals in it, you fearing them as you fear yourselves? Thus do we explain the signs to an understanding people.

29.Thomas Cleary: No, those who do wrong follow their own desires without knowledge. Then who guides those whom God has led astray? There are no helpers for them.

30.Thomas Cleary: So turn your being to religion in sincere devotion by God-given nature, according to which God created humanity. There is no changing the nature created by God. That is the right religion, but most of humanity does not know.

31.Thomas Cleary: Turning to God repentant, be conscientious and prayerful, and do not be idolators,

32.Thomas Cleary: those who sp1inter their religion and have hecon1e sectarian, each party delighting in what they have.

35.Thomas Cleary: Have We sent down to them an authority who speaks of what they have idolized?

36.Thomas Cleary: And when We have people taste mercy, they rejoice in it; but if ill befalls them for what their own hands have brought on, then they despair.

37.Thomas Cleary: Do they not see that God expands and restricts the provision of whomever God will? Surely in that is a sign for a people who believe.

38.Thomas Cleary: So give their right to kin and the poor and the wayfarer: that is best for those who seek the presence and favor of God; and they are the ones who thrive.

39.Thomas Cleary: Whatever you give from excess profit that it may grow even more invested in people's wealth does not increase with God; but what you give in charity seeking the presence and favor of God is what will be compounded.

40.Thomas Cleary: God is the one who created you all. then provided you sustenance, then will cause you to die, then will bring you to life. Are there an1ong your idols any who can do aught of that? Glory to God, exalted beyond any association.

41.Thomas Cleary: Corruption has appeared on land and on sea because of what human hands have earned to make them taste some of what they did, that they may turn back.

42.Thomas Cleary: Say, "Travel the earth and see how those before you ended up: most of them were idolatrous.â€

43.Thomas Cleary: So direct your being to the right religion before there comes a day from God that cannot be averted: on that day they'll be divided.

44.Thomas Cleary: Those who were ungrateful bear responsibility for their ingratitude; while those who do good works prepare for the repose of their own souls,

45.Thomas Cleary: that God may requite from the bounty divine those who have faith and do good works. Surely God does not love the ungrateful who disbelieve.

46.Thomas Cleary: And among the signs of God is that the winds are sent as bearers of glad tidings and to have you taste of the mercy divine; and that the ships may sail by divine decree, and that you may all seek from the bounty of God, and that you may be thankful.

47.Thomas Cleary: And We have indeed sent before you Envoys to their people, who brought them clarifications; then We took revenge on those who committed crimes. And it was incumbent upon us to help the faithful believers.

48.Thomas Cleary: God is the one who sends the winds that stir up a cloud, and God spreads it in the sky. according to divine will, and makes it into pieces, and you see the rain issuing from within it. And it is showered on whomever God will from among the servants of God: then they welcome it,

49.Thomas Cleary: though earlier on, before it was sent down upon them, they were indeed in despair.

50.Thomas Cleary: So look at the traces of the mercy of God, how it enlivens the earth after her death. Indeed, God is the lifegiver to the dead; and God has power over all things.

51.Thomas Cleary: And if We sent a wind and they saw it yellowing, they would thereafter surely become ungrateful.

52.Thomas Cleary: So in fact you cannot cause the dead to hear, nor can you cause the deaf to hear the call when they have turned their backs.

53.Thomas Cleary: And you are not the guide of the blind out of their error; you cannot make anyone hear but those who believe in Our signs and have submitted.

54.Thomas Cleary: God is the one who created you all weak, then gave strength after weakness, then gave weakness and old age after strength. God creates whatever God will; and God is all-knowing, all-powerful.

55.Thomas Cleary: And on the day the hour arrives the guilty will swear they only lingered a while; that is how deluded they were.

56.Thomas Cleary: And those to whom was given knowledge and faith will say, â€œIn fact you lingered, according to the Book of God, until the day of resurrection. And this is the day of resurrection, although you have not perceived."

57.Thomas Cleary: So on that day the excuse of wrongdoers will not be of use to them, and no reconciliation is possible for them.

58.Thomas Cleary: And We have set forth every ideal for humankind in this Recital: but if you brought a verse to ingrates who disbelieve, they would surely say, "'You are nothing but liars!"

59.Thomas Cleary: Thus does God stamp the hearts of those who do not know.

60.Thomas Cleary: So be patient, for the promise of God is true. And let those who are uncertain not divert you at all.

11.Thomas Cleary: This is the creation of God: now show me what anyone else has created. No, those who abuse are in obvious error.

12.Thomas Cleary: And We gave Luqmaan wisdom that he would be thankful to God. And whoever is thankful is only thankful for his own soul. And if anyone is ungrateful, well, God is free from all needs, worthy of all praise.

And follow the path of those who turn to Me: then your return is to Me, and I will inform you of what you used to Jo.

16.Thomas Cleary: "My son! In fact be there the weight of a mustard seed, even in a rock, or in the skies, or in the earth, God will bring it forth: for God is most subtly aware.

18.Thomas Cleary: â€œAnd do not avert your face from people in arrogance or contempt, nor walk haughtily on the earth: for God loves no conceited braggart.

19.Thomas Cleary: "Adopt a middle course in your walk, and lower your voice; for the worst of sounds is the braying of an ass."

20.Thomas Cleary: Have you all not seen that God made everything in the heavens and the earth subservient to you, and has showered you all with favor divine outwardly and inwardly. But there are people who dispute about God while having no knowledge and no guidance and no enlightening Book.

30.Thomas Cleary: That is because God is the Truth, and whatever else they call on is falsehood; and God is infinite in loftiness and magnitude.
